Requirements:
The RN-BSN program admits once a year for the spring semester. Application to the University and the School of Nursing are due August 1-31. There are two separate application processes, one to the University and one to the School of Nursing. To be considered for admission to the RN-BSN program, all applicants must have the following:

- A current, valid, and unrestricted California Registered Nurse license.
- An Associate Degree in Nursing (ADN) or a diploma in nursing from an accredited school.
- A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
- Completion of all prerequisite courses with a 'C' or higher.
- A 'B' or higher in all nursing transfer courses.

1. Be a high school graduate or have the legal equivalent.
2. Complete the 15-unit college preparatory "a-g" course pattern with a grade of C- or better.

Requirements:
The minor in social work offers a general background for students interested in careers in the human services, or for those who want to broaden their understanding of the field of social work. Coursework for the minor is intended to expand a student's knowledge of social problems, social services, social policy, and social work interventions. The social work minor may be taken by students in any major.

Required Courses
SWRK 170 Introduction to Social Work (3)
SWRK 305 Social Welfare Policy and Services I (3)
SWRK 330 Introduction to Social Work Practice (3)

Elective Courses
Select nine units from the following:
SWRK 202 Diversity and Social Justice (3)
SWRK 300 Human Behavior and the Social Environment I (3)
SWRK 320 Issues in Child and Family Welfare Services (3)
SWRK 335 Interviewing and Interventions in Social Work Practice (3)
SWRK 430 Social Work Practice with Groups (3)
SWRK 439 Crisis Intervention (3)
SWRK 483 Social Work with Older Adults (3)
SWRK 484 Social Work Practice in Health Care (3)

Admission to the social work major is a selective process. Students seeking admission to the social work major must first be admitted to the University as social work pre-majors. Social work pre-majors apply for admission to the major during the spring semester of their sophomore year, after completion of the social work pre-major curriculum. The School of Social Work distributes applications during November each year. To be considered for admission to the social work major, a student must have completed the following with a grade of C or better: SWRK 170 Introduction to Social Work (a required GE, Area D course); SWRK 201 Social Work and Social Welfare; SWRK 202 Communication in Social Work Practice; ENGL 130W or I (or an equivalent 'W' course). You must also have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5 and complete a personal statement. Personal statements are reviewed by faculty and applicants are invited for an interview. Final admission decisions are based on the student's personal statement, interview, GPA, and demonstrated commitment to the values and ethics of the social work profession.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Social Work

Requirements:
The minor in sociology consists of a minimum of 18 units of coursework, nine of which must be upper-division. You must receive a grade of C- or higher in all courses required for the minor.

Course Requirements for the Minor:
Required Lower-Division Course (3 units):
SOCI 100 Introduction to Sociology

Elective Lower-Division Courses (6 units):
Select two of the following:
SOCI 200 Social Problems
SOCI 230 Race and Ethnicity
SOCI 240 Introduction to Gender and Sexuality Studies

Elective Upper-Division Courses (9 units):
Select any three upper-division sociology courses. At least one upper-division SOCI course must be taken in residence.

To be considered for admission to Chico State as a first-time freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements:

Be a high school graduate or have a GED/Hised.
Complete the 15-unit comprehensive "A-G" pattern of college prep courses.
Have a 2.5 or greater "A-G" GPA if you're a California resident or California high school graduate.
Have a 3.0 or greater "A-G" GPA if you are not a California resident or California high school graduate.
